greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = min(n, A225546(n)) for all other n, except for odd primes p, f(p) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
Aux331301(n) = if((n%2)&&isprime(n),0,A331288(n)); \\ Needs also code from A331288.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 21 2020
